text: tacloban has been flattened this is the
town's high street in the air the stench
of death we saw dozens of bodies rotting
by the roadside three days after the
typhoon struck and nobody to bury them
among the debris at the city's airport a
makeshift hospital many of the patients
being treated without anesthetics this
woman has just given birth a baby girl
bayar joy born into a world upturned and
next to them another young woman also in
labor people waiting here are desperate
to get out on any plane they can find
this is my debt my dad's only chance for
life I said either we have to leave
tomorrow morning today or we're gonna go
somewhere else but he needs dialysis and
he's been off now for two days and he's
in critical condition hundreds of people
have now come to the airport attack
lebanner desperate to try and get hold
of any aid that's coming in most of them
here are saying they've lost everything
their house is completely gone and as I
say totally desperate now we are so very
hungry and thirsty that's why we're here
because even it's so if you have water
or food there maybe you can give us but
they're not being given enough this used
to be a supermarket people who have
nothing are looking for anything they
can find and without more aid what
little there is we'll run out soon
John Donnison BBC news in Tacloban
